intro: Cephaelis panchocoensis, commonly known as the Panchoco fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique floral structure makes it a subject of interest for both botanists and horticulturists.
